business.headline: India orders IndiGo to end agreement with Turkish Airlines amid diplomatic tensionsThe Indian government has ordered IndiGo Airlines to terminate its damp lease agreement with Turkish Airlines by August 31. This decision comes in response to Turkey's continued support for Pakistan against India. The aviation regulator DGCA has granted a final three-month extension to the current lease, which was set to expire on May 31. IndiGo is currently operating two Boeing aircraft on damp lease from Turkish Airlines. The move is part of India's broader response to Turkey's actions, including supplying arms to Pakistan and condemning India's Operation Sindhu.

India reduces import tax on crude edible oils by 10% to bring down food pricesThe reduction in import tax will effectively bring down the total import duty on the three oils to 16.5 per cent from an earlier 27.5 per cent.

IndiGo to cut ties with Turkish Airlines amid row over Ankara's support to PakThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation said IndiGo gave an undertaking that it will terminate the lease with Turkish Airlines by August 31 and will not seek a further extension.

ITR-1 and ITR-4 Excel utilities out: Check who can file and what's new this yearExcel utilities for ITR-1 and ITR-4 are now available for AY 2025–26. Taxpayers can visit the income tax e-filing site to download and use them for filing returns for FY 2024–25.
Gensol misses May payment for loan on BluSmart cabs: ReportGensol Engineering reportedly missed a payment of about Rs 4 crore to its pass-through certificate (PTC) holders in May.
India's economic growth hits 4-year low of 6.5% in FY25The real GDP growth for the March quarter (Q4) stood at 7.4%, which is the fastest among all four quarters of the year.
Sensex closes 182 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; IT stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 182 points to end at 81,451.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 82.90 points to close at 24,750.70.

From UPI withdrawals to online corrections: 5 expected features of EPFO 3.0EPFO's upcoming system aims to enhance financial flexibility for employees with features like instant UPI and ATM withdrawals, auto-claim settlements, and expanded withdrawal reasons.

Meet Leena Tewari, the USV chairperson who bought India's costliest flatsLeena is the chairperson of USV, a Mumbai-based pharmaceutical company, which was started by her late father, Vithal Gandhi, in partnership with Revlon in 1961. Forbes estimates Leena's net worth at $3.9 billion, as of May 30, 2025, making her one of India's richest women.

Explained: Why Arshad Warsi, wife Maria Goretti were banned by Sebi for 1 yearArshad Warsi and Maria Goretti bought shares of Sadhna Broadcast Limited (now known as Crystal Business System Ltd) from other individuals who were also named in the Sebi order.

How Trump's tariff tsunami is reshaping global economyIn just over four months, Trump's flurry of trade actions, alternating between shock-and-awe tariffs and strategic pauses, has upended conventional expectations.

Waiting for Form 16? Here's when will you get it and what to checkEmployers are required to issue Form 16 to employees if they've deducted TDS from their salary. It consists of two parts and shows how much salary was paid and how much tax was deducted during the year.

entertainment.headline: Kamal Hassan's effigy burnt as protests by pro-Kannada groups intensifyActor Kamal Haasan's effigies were burnt across Karnataka as protests against the actor intensified amid the language row. His film, 'Thug Life', is scheduled to release on June 5.

Khaleja re-release box office Day 2: Mahesh Babu's film hunts records globallyMahesh Babu's 'Khaleja' re-released in theatres on May 30, and the film has already started setting fresh records at the box office. It has emerged as the biggest Indian re-release opener in North America.

Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 9: Rajkummar Rao's film smashes Rs 50 crore mark'Bhool Chuk Maaf' has entered its second weekend at the box office. The film has seen fantastic growth in its second Saturday collection, moving past the benchmark of Rs 50 crore.

Nagarjuna invites Revanth Reddy to younger son Akhil Akkineni-Zainab's weddingActor Nagarjuna met Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy to extend the invitation to his son Akhil Akkineni's wedding with Zainab Ravdjee. He was accompanied by his wife Amala and the bride's parents.

Dhanush, Aishwarya Rajinikanth come together for son's school graduation. PicsDhanush and Aishwarya Rajinikanth were proud parents as their eldest son, Yathra, graduated from school. The couple got divorced in November 2024.

Bring back Chinmayi: Samantha supports singer after being shadow-banned for 8 yearsActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared singer Chinmayi Sripada's viral clip from 'Thug Life' music launch event. She questioned the ban on the singer since 2018.

Naga Chaitanya wishes lady love Sobhita Dhulipala on birthday with vacation picActor Naga Chaitanya wished his wife Sobhita Dhuliapala on her thirty third birthday with a cute selfie. The post drew warm reactions from fans.

Samantha plays pickleball with Raj Nidimoru, gives glimpse of her happy weekendActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a clip of herself playing pickleball with director Raj Nidimoru. The two are rumoured to be dating.

Manushi Chhillar calls out misogynistic remarks against women: A deep-rooted biasManushi Chhillar has spoken against the deep-rooted misogynistic mindset undermining women's success in the entertainment industry. She called out the disrespectful comments against women achievers.

Pankaj Tripathi's AI-generated image as Hera Pheri's Baburao goes viral, fans reactActor Pankaj Tripathi's AI-generated image as Baburao has caught the attention of internet users. The picture has led to debate over casting Tripathi in 'Hera Pheri 3' after Paresh Rawal's departure.

Anupam Kher, victim of terrorism, applauds Operation Sindoor: Felt vindicatedAnupam Kher shared his personal pain as a victim of terrorism and reflects on the plight of Kashmiri Pandits. He commended the Indian Army's Operation Sindoor and urged strong leadership to combat terrorism effectively.

The Academy revisits iconic Aamir Khan song from Lagaan, fans call it legendaryThe Academy revisited a clip of the popular song 'Radha Kaise Na Jale' from 'Lagaan' featuring Aamir Khan and Gracy Singh. Indian fans got nostalgic about the iconic track and the groundbreaking visuals.

Homebound cinematographer accused of sexual harassment. Dharma Productions reacts'Homebound' cinematographer Pratik Shah has been accused of sexually inappropriate behaviour. He deleted his Instagram profile after allegations from over 20 women.

Nobody had faith in Priyanka Chopra: Director Suneel Darshan on Andaaz castingFilmmaker Suneel Darshan shared exclusive insights on the casting choices behind the 2003 hit 'Andaaz' that introduced Lara Dutta and Priyanka Chopra to Bollywood. The film's fresh pairing and Akshay Kumar's support played key roles in their breakthrough.

Tom Cruise on admiring Keanu Reeves in The Matrix, John Wick: I dig those moviesActor Tom Cruise recently opened up about his admiration for 'Speed,' 'The Matrix' and 'John Wick' franchise featuring Keanu Reeves. The 'Mission Impossible: 8' actor praised Reeves for his charisma in his films.

Movie ticket prices to reduce in Tamil Nadu ahead of Thug Life release. Here's howTamil Nadu movie ticket prices will reduce after the government slashed the local body tax by half. Kamal Haasan had earlier appealed to the government to cut down the local body tax.

Wasn't easy to reach Akshay Kumar: Vishnu Manchu on star-studded Kannappa castingActor Vishnu Manchu discussed the emotional and creative process behind casting for 'Kannappa', a personal passion project for his father Mohan Babu. He highlighted the importance of personal relationships and support from industry veterans in bringing the project to life.

Javed Akhtar weighs in on Bollywood's silence on Operation SindoorJaved Akhtar addressed criticism of Bollywood's silence on Operation Sindoor, stressing that not everyone is obliged to speak. He also challenged the notion of expecting artistes to respond to all issues when there are risks involved.

Actor Vishnu Manchu accuses brother Manoj over alleged theft of Kannappa hard diskTelugu actor Vishnu Manchu accused his brother Manoj Manchu over the alleged theft of Kannappa's hard disk. Over the past few months, the brothers have been involved in a family feud, which resulted in Manoj being ousted from their father Mohan Babu's house.

general news.headline: Stop blaming others: India rips Pak at UN meet over Indus Waters Treaty remarkIndia dismissed Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's remarks on the Indus Waters Treaty as unwarranted, asserting at a UN conference that Islamabad's support for cross-border terrorism is the real obstacle to the treaty's implementation.

Flash floods, landslides kill 25 in Northeast after 2 days of torrential rainTorrential monsoon rains have claimed at least 25 lives across Assam, Mizoram, Arunachal Pradesh, and Manipur, unleashing deadly landslides and flash floods. Authorities have issued alerts across the region as more rain looms.

Terrorist became a father while in jail: Asaduddin Owaisi exposes Pak in AlgeriaAsaduddin Owaisi cited an example of Pakistan handing out special treatment to the mastermind of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi, while he was in jail. Addressing the Indian diaspora, the Hyderabad MP highlighted that a high-profile prisoner like Lakhvi was allowed to become a father while incarcerated.
Bridge collapses in Russia as freight train passes over it, 2nd case in 24 hoursBridge collapses in Russia's Kursk as freight train passes over it, says governor; second incident in 24 hours

In tiger territory, LPG and toilet emerge as big lifesaversIn tiger territories across India, a humble toilet and LPG connection at home are saving precious lives. This success story of the Swachh Bharat Yojana and the Ujjwala scheme is unfolding in faraway forests even as overall deaths from tiger attacks rise in India.

Fed drug-laced laddoo, gangraped at Kanpur ashram: Taekwondo player's big chargeThe woman alleged she was given a laddoo inside the ashram and passed out shortly after consuming it. She claimed that she was then gang-raped by Mahto, the ashram's mahant (chief priest), and several others.

From 'oppa' to comrade: North Korea's phones auto-correct to fit party lineA smuggled phone has revealed the extreme extent of North Korea's censorship under Kim Jong Un, where everything South Korean is banned, phones autocorrect words, internet access is blocked, and authorities secretly monitor users.

My whole world: Tej Pratap's emotional message for Lalu Yadav after RJD ousterThis post marks Tej Pratap's first public statement referencing his parents since the RJD leadership expelled him for six years on May 25, citing "irresponsible behaviour".

No Mbappe, No Problem: How Enrique's PSG conquered Europe without superstarsLuis Enrique transformed PSG from star-studded chaos to a disciplined powerhouse, leading them to their first Champions League title in 2025. His tactical overhaul ended years of heartbreak, finally delivering glory.

Biden would get lost in his White House closet, whistleblower tells US SenatorSenator Josh Hawley's claim that Joe Biden once got lost in his White House closet added to Republican-led inquiries into the former President's mental acuity, medical transparency, and alleged delegated decision-making.

Jugaad on wheels: Sukhoi jet tyres power Lord Jagannath's chariotISKCON Kolkata spokesperson Radharaman Das admitted that their demand for new wheels took the company that manufactures tyres for Sukhoi fighter jets by surprise. When asked for a quotation, the manufacturer wondered why anyone would request Sukhoi tyres and for what purpose.

Kamal Hassan's effigy burnt as protests by pro-Kannada groups intensifyActor Kamal Haasan's effigies were burnt across Karnataka as protests against the actor intensified amid the language row. His film, 'Thug Life', is scheduled to release on June 5.

Video: Buzz on Washington streets as 250 million bees escape after truck crashesAround 250 million honeybees escaped after a truck carrying hives overturned near Lynden, Washington. Local beekeepers rushed to rescue and restore the displaced hives.

Hit the jackpot, lost the girl: Canada man sues ex over missing $3.6 millionA Canadian man claims his girlfriend vanished with a $3.6 million lottery prize after collecting it on his behalf. He is now suing her for allegedly ghosting him and cutting off all contact.

Influencer shares how Nithin Kamath offered help when he was nearly brokeInfluencer Revant Himatsingka shared how a quiet gesture from Zerodha co-founder Nithin Kamath uplifted him during one of the most difficult phases of his life.

Mumbai man sets wife on fire after she refuses sex, arrested for attempted murderBased on the woman's complaint, the man was arrested under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita provisions for attempt to murder and other offences.

Comeback kings MI face PBKS in final hurdle before summit clashPunjab Kings surprised everyone with their unique team strategy but fell short in Qualifier 1. Now, they face Mumbai Indians at Narendra Modi Stadium, hoping to continue their unexpected IPL journey.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Hamas seeks changes in Gaza ceasefire proposal, US envoy calls it 'unacceptable'Hamas seeks changes to US Gaza ceasefire plan, citing aid and withdrawal terms, as famine deepens and Palestinians seize UN trucks; US envoy Witkoff calls Hamas response 'totally unacceptable'.

'Feels like home': Interview video of Indian 'spy' in Pak alerted agenciesKasim was apprehended from the Deeg area of Mewat in Rajasthan on Thursday for allegedly spying at the behest of Pakistani intelligence agency Inter-Service Intelligence (ISI).

Irritable Bowel Disease is now an epidemic: Why India is seeing a surgeInflammatory bowel disease is increasing rapidly across India due to dietary and lifestyle changes. Doctors reveal how delayed diagnosis and social stigma are amplifying the challenges of effective management.

Government misled nation: Mallikarjun Kharge on top general's 'jets downed' remarkMallikarjun Kharge's attack came after CDS Chauhan said that an unspecified number of India's fighter jets were downed initially during Operation Sindoor precision strikes on May 7, but asserted that the armed forces rectified mistakes quickly to hit Islamabad again.
Thailand's Opal Suchata Chuangsri crowned Miss World 2025Thailand's Opal Suchata Chuangsri has won the Miss World 2025 title. Nandini Gupta represented India and made it to the top 20 finalists.

Israel claims it killed Hamas leader Mohammad Sinwar in May 13 strikeMohammad Sinwar was the younger brother of Yahya Sinwar, Hamas's deceased leader and the mastermind of the October 7, 2023 attack on Israel, who was killed by Israel in a military operation in the Gaza Strip last October.

sports.headline: Rinku Singh to get engaged with Samajwadi Party MP Priya Saroj on June 8Indian cricketer Rinku Singh will get engaged to Priya Saroj, an MP at the Samajwadi Party, on Sunday, June 8 at a hotel in Lucknow.

PSG deserved to win: Simone Inzaghi gracefully accepts loss in finalSimone Inzaghi's Inter Milan had a tough day in the office after Paris Saint Germain defeated them 5-0 in the final of the Champions League on Saturday at Allianz Arena.

Virat Kohli bailed out of the challenging England tour, claims former spinnerStar India batter Virat Kohli bailed out of the challenging England tour, feels former England spinner Monty Panesar. Kohli announced his retirement from Tests ahead of the all-important series set to begin from June 20.

No Mbappe, No Problem: How Enrique's PSG conquered Europe without superstarsLuis Enrique transformed PSG from star-studded chaos to a disciplined powerhouse, leading them to their first Champions League title in 2025. His tactical overhaul ended years of heartbreak, finally delivering glory.

French Open, Day 8: Sabalenka, Alcaraz, Swiatek eye prequarters berthFrench Open 2025 Day 8 Order of Play: Iga Swiatek, Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka will be in action on Sunday. Rohan Bopanna and Yuki Bhambri will play their respective third round matches in men's doubles.

India's N Sriram Balaji crashes out in doubles second roundFrench Open 2025: N Sriram Balaji and Miguel Angel Reyes-Varela failed to make their way through to the third round after Simone Bolelli and Andrea Vavassori beat them 6-3, 6-4 on Saturday.

Qualifier 2: PBKS are rattled, but there's one MI loophole they can exploitIPL 2025, PBKS vs MI: Mumbai Indians haven't won a single match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad since 2014. On Sunday, MI will return to the same venue in Qualifier 2 against Punjab Kings.

Comeback kings MI face PBKS in final hurdle before summit clashPunjab Kings surprised everyone with their unique team strategy but fell short in Qualifier 1. Now, they face Mumbai Indians at Narendra Modi Stadium, hoping to continue their unexpected IPL journey.

Enrique pays PSG tribute to late daughter: Don't need UCL to remember herHead coach Luis Enrique led PSG to their first Champions League title, honoring his late daughter Xana with a heartfelt tribute, as the team crushed Inter Milan 5-0 in a historic treble-winning final.

Tom Haines leads England Lions' fightback as Karun Nair's 204 help India A post 557Tom Haines hundred led the fightback for England Lions against India A after the visitors posted 557 on Saturday, May 31. Karun Nair starred for India A with 204 runs and received support from Dhruv Jurel and Sarfaraz Khan.

French Open: Djokovic advances to 4th Round with dominant win vs MisolicNovak Djokovic continued his dominant run at the French Open, advancing smoothly to the fourth round after a straight sets win over Filip Musolic. Meanwhile, India's N Sriram Balaji saw his campaign end early in the doubles draw.

Comeback kings MI face PBKS in final hurdle before summit clashPunjab Kings surprised everyone with their unique team strategy but fell short in Qualifier 1. Now, they face Mumbai Indians at Narendra Modi Stadium, hoping to continue their unexpected IPL journey.

Enrique pays PSG tribute to late daughter: Don't need UCL to remember herHead coach Luis Enrique led PSG to their first Champions League title, honoring his late daughter Xana with a heartfelt tribute, as the team crushed Inter Milan 5-0 in a historic treble-winning final.

Karun Nair starred for India A with 204 runs and received support from Dhruv Jurel and Sarfaraz Khan.

Meanwhile, India's N Sriram Balaji saw his campaign end early in the doubles draw.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
